title: Walks
content: A "walk" within a graph is usually defined for simple graphs, multigraphs or even pseudographs as "alternating sequence of vertices and edges x0 , e1 , x1 , e2 , ... , e(l) , x(l) where e(i) = x(i-1)x(i), 0<i<=l.", see Definition of [Bollobas] p. 4. This definition requires the edges to connect two vertices at most (loops are also allowed: if e(i) is a loop, then x(i-1) = x(i)). For hypergraphs containing hyperedges (i.e. edges connecting more than two vertices), however, a more general definition is needed. Two approaches for a definition applicable for arbitrary hypergraphs are used in the literature: "walks on the vertex level" and "walks on the edge level" (see Aksoy, Joslyn, Marrero, Praggastis, Purvine: "Hypernetwork science via high-order hypergraph walks", June 2020, ~ https://doi.org/10.1140/epjds/s13688-020-00231-0 ): "walks on the edge level": For a positive integer s, an s-walk of length k between hyperedges f and g is a sequence of hyperedges, f=e(0), e(1), ... , e(k)=g, where for j=1, ... , k, e(j-1) =/= e(j) and e(j-1) and e(j) have at least s vertices in common (according to Aksoy et al.). "walks on the vertex level": For a positive integer s, an s-walk of length k between vertices a and b is a sequence of vertices, a=v(0), v(1), ... , v(k)=b, where for j=1, ... , k, v(j-1) and v(j) are connected by at least s edges (analogous to Aksoy et al.). There are two imperfections for the definition for "walks on the edge level": one is that a walk of length 1 consists of two edges (or a walk of length 0 consists of one edge), whereas a walk of length 1 on the vertex level consists of two vertices and one edge (or a walk of length 0 consists of one vertex and no edge). The other is that edges, especially loops, can be traversed only once (and not repeatedly) because of the condition e(j-1) =/= e(j). The latter is avoided in the definition for ` EdgWalks `, see ~ df-ewlks . To be compatible with the (usual) definition of walks for pseudographs, walks also suitable for arbitrary hypergraphs are defined "on the vertex level" in the following as ` Walks `, see ~ df-wlks , restricting s to 1. ~ wlk1ewlk shows that such a 1-walk "on the vertex level" induces a 1-walk "on the edge level".

df-ewlks
blocks.content: Define the set of all s-walks of edges (in a hypergraph) corresponding to s-walks "on the edge level" discussed in Aksoy et al. For an extended nonnegative integer s, an s-walk is a sequence of hyperedges, e(0), e(1), ... , e(k), where e(j-1) and e(j) have at least s vertices in common (for j=1, ... , k). In contrast to the definition in Aksoy et al., ` s = 0 ` (a 0-walk is an arbitrary sequence of hyperedges) and ` s = +oo ` (then the number of common vertices of two adjacent hyperedges must be infinite) are allowed. Furthermore, it is not forbidden that adjacent hyperedges are equal. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-ewlks(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cewlks, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cxnn0, cab(s2, wsbc(s3, cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s2), cword(cdm(cv(s3)))), wral(s4, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s2))), wbr(cv(s1), cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(cv(s3), cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s4), cmin, nat1))), cfv(cv(s3), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4))))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
}

axiom df-ewlks(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ EdgWalks =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0* ‚Ü¶ { s2 |[(iEdg ` s0)/ s3](s2 ‚àà Word(dom(s3))‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(1[..^](# ` s2)), s1[‚â§](# `((s3 `(s2 `(s4[-]1)))‚ãÇ(s3 `(s2 ` s4))))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-wlks
blocks.content: Define the set of all walks (in a hypergraph). Such walks correspond to the s-walks "on the vertex level" (with s = 1), and also to 1-walks "on the edge level" (see ~ wlk1walk ) discussed in Aksoy et al. The predicate ` F ( Walks `` G ) P ` can be read as "The pair ` <. F , P >. ` represents a walk in a graph ` G ` ", see also ~ iswlk . The condition ` { ( p `` k ) , ( p `` ( k + 1 ) ) } ` ` C_ ( ( iEdg `` g ) `` ( f `` k ) ) ` (hereinafter referred to as C) would not be sufficient, because the repetition of a vertex in a walk (i.e. ` ( p `` k ) = ( p `` ( k + 1 ) ) ` should be allowed only if there is a loop at ` ( p `` k ) ` . Otherwise, C would be fulfilled by each edge containing ` ( p `` k ) ` . According to the definition of [Bollobas] p. 4.: "A walk W in a graph is an alternating sequence of vertices and edges x0 , e1 , x1 , e2 , ... , e(l) , x(l) ...", a walk can be represented by two mappings f from { 1 , ... , n } and p from { 0 , ... , n }, where f enumerates the (indices of the) edges, and p enumerates the vertices. So the walk is represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n). (Contributed by AV, 30-Dec-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-wlks(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cwlks, cmpt(s0, universe, copab(s1, s2, w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(s0))))), wf(cv(s2), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, cv(s1))), cfv(cvtx, cv(s0))), wral(s3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s1))), wif(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3))), csn(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wss(cpr(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), caddc, nat1))), cfv(cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-wlks(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ Walks =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s1, s2 > |(s1 ‚àà Word(dom((iEdg ` s0)))‚àß(s2 :(0[...](# ` s1))‚Üí(Vtx ` s0))‚àß ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` s1)), if((s2 ` s3)=(s2 `(s3[+]1)),((iEdg ` s0)`(s1 ` s3))= {(s2 ` s3)}, {(s2 ` s3),(s2 `(s3[+]1))} ‚äÜ((iEdg ` s0)`(s1 ` s3)))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-wlkson
blocks.content: Define the collection of walks with particular endpoints (in a hypergraph). The predicate ` F ( A ( WalksOn `` G ) B ) P ` can be read as "The pair ` <. F , P >. ` represents a walk from vertex ` A ` to vertex ` B ` in a graph ` G ` ", see also ~ iswlkon . This corresponds to the "x0-x(l)-walks", see Definition in [Bollobas] p. 5. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens and Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 28-Dec-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-wlkson(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cwlkson, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), copab(s3, s4, w3a(wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cwlks, cv(s0)), cv(s4)), wceq(cfv(cv(s4), nat0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s4), cfv(chash, cv(s3))), cv(s2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
}

axiom df-wlkson(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ WalksOn =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0), s2 ‚àà(Vtx ` s0)‚Ü¶ { < s3, s4 > |(s3[(Walks ` s0)]s4 ‚àß(s4 ` 0)= s1 ‚àß(s4 `(# ` s3))= s2)}))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
}

thm isewlk(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cxnn0), wcel(c3, c4)), wb(wcel(c3, co(c0, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, cv(s0))))))))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cxnn0), wcel(c3, c4)), wcel(c3, co(c0, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))))))), wcel(c3, cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))))))))
  eleq2d(c3, co(c0, cewlks, c2), cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))))), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cxnn0), wcel(c3, c4)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cxnn0), wcel(c3, c4), wceq(co(c0, cewlks, c2), cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))))))))
  ewlksfval(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c2, c5)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cxnn0), wcel(c3, c4), wb(wcel(c3, cab(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))))))), wa(wcel(c3, cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, cv(s0))))))))))
  elabg(hs0, c3, c4, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))))), wa(wcel(c3, cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))))))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))), wcel(c3, cword(cdm(c5))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c3)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c5, cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, cv(s0))))))))

  oveq2d(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cfv(chash, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))

  ineq12d(cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c5, cfv(c3, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  fveq2d(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  fveq1(cv(hs0), c3, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))
  fveq2d(c5, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), cfv(c3, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c3))
  fveq1(cv(hs0), c3, cv(s0))

  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)

thm ewlkprop(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), w3a(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  mpdan(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), w3a(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)))
  elmpt2cl(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, cewlks, c2, universe, cxnn0, cab(hs2, wsbc(hs3, cfv(ciedg, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cword(cdm(cv(hs3)))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs2))), wbr(cv(hs1), cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(cv(hs3), cfv(cv(hs2), co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(cv(hs3), cfv(cv(hs2), cv(s0)))))))))))
  df-ewlks(hs0, hs1, hs2, hs3, s0)
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0))), w3a(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))))
  simpr(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)))
  imp(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))))
  pm2.43a(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))))
  expcom(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))))))
  biimpd(wa(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2))), wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))))
  3expa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0), wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))))))
  isewlk(s0, c1, universe, c2, c0, co(c1, cewlks, c2), c3)
  3anass(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, cxnn0)), wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wral(s0, co(nat1, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c2, cle, cfv(chash, cin(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)

blocks.name: wlkprop
blocks.content: Properties of a walk. (Contributed by AV, 5-Nov-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm wlkprop(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c4), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  mpcom(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c4), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))), w3a(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
  brfvopab(hs0, hs1, c0, cwlks, c1, c2, w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c3))), wf(cv(hs1), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), c4), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wif(wceq(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), csn(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))))
  wksfval(hs0, hs1, s0, c1, universe, c3, c4)
  biimpd(w3a(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c4), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))))
  iswlk(s0, c1, universe, c0, universe, c2, universe, c3, c4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

}

thm wlkprop(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà Word(dom(c3))‚àß(c2 :(0[...](# ` c0))‚Üí c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c0)), if((c2 ` s0)=(c2 `(s0[+]1)),(c3 `(c0 ` s0))= {(c2 ` s0)}, {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c3 `(c0 ` s0))))))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Vtx ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(iEdg ` c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  mpcom(c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2, (c0 ‚àà Word(dom(c3))‚àß(c2 :(0[...](# ` c0))‚Üí c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c0)), if((c2 ` s0)=(c2 `(s0[+]1)),(c3 `(c0 ` s0))= {(c2 ` s0)}, {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c3 `(c0 ` s0))))), (c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå))
  brfvopab(hs0, hs1, c0, cwlks, c1, c2, (hs0 ‚àà Word(dom(c3))‚àß(hs1 :(0[...](# ` hs0))‚Üí c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` hs0)), if((hs1 ` s0)=(hs1 `(s0[+]1)),(c3 `(hs0 ` s0))= {(hs1 ` s0)}, {(hs1 ` s0),(hs1 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c3 `(hs0 ` s0))))))
  wksfval(hs0, hs1, s0, c1, universe, c3, c4)
  biimpd((c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå), c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2, (c0 ‚àà Word(dom(c3))‚àß(c2 :(0[...](# ` c0))‚Üí c4)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c0)), if((c2 ` s0)=(c2 `(s0[+]1)),(c3 `(c0 ` s0))= {(c2 ` s0)}, {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c3 `(c0 ` s0))))))
  iswlk(s0, c1, universe, c0, universe, c2, universe, c3, c4)

}

blocks.name: wlkv
blocks.content: The classes involved in a walk are sets. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 31-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 3-Feb-2021.)

thm wlkv(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), w3a(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
} = {
  brfvopab(hs0, hs1, c0, cwlks, c1, c2, w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c1)))), wf(cv(hs1), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wral(hs2, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wif(wceq(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(hs2), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c1), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), csn(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wss(cpr(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(hs2), caddc, nat1))), cfv(cfv(ciedg, c1), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))))))
  wksfval(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, universe, cfv(ciedg, c1), cfv(cvtx, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ciedg, c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(ciedg, c1))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  diff.hs2.c(c1)

thm wlkv(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2 ‚Üí(c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå))

blocks.name: iswlkg
blocks.content: Generalization of ~ iswlk : Conditions for two classes to represent a walk. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm iswlkg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c2, cfv(cwlks, c0), c3), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wif(wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c2, cfv(cwlks, c0), c3), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wif(wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wbr(c2, cfv(cwlks, c0), c3), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))))
  syl(wbr(c2, cfv(cwlks, c0), c3), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)), w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  wlkv(c2, c0, c3)
  3simpc(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wi(w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wif(wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))))
  3adant3(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wif(wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  anim12i(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))
  elex(c2, cword(cdm(c4)))
  elexd(c3, co(c5, cpm, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5))
  fpm(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5)
  ovex(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2))
  fvexi(c5, cvtx, c0)
  3expib(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe), wb(wbr(c2, cfv(cwlks, c0), c3), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wif(wceq(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c3, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))))))
  iswlk(s0, c0, c1, c2, universe, c3, universe, c4, c5)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iswlkg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2[(Walks ` c0)]c3 ‚Üî(c2 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß(c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), if((c3 ` s0)=(c3 `(s0[+]1)),(c4 `(c2 ` s0))= {(c3 ` s0)}, {(c3 ` s0),(c3 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c4 `(c2 ` s0)))))))
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(iEdg ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  pm5.21ndd(c0 ‚àà c1, c2[(Walks ` c0)]c3, (c2 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß(c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), if((c3 ` s0)=(c3 `(s0[+]1)),(c4 `(c2 ` s0))= {(c3 ` s0)}, {(c3 ` s0),(c3 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c4 `(c2 ` s0))))), (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  a1i(c0 ‚àà c1, (c2[(Walks ` c0)]c3 ‚Üí(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå)))
  syl(c2[(Walks ` c0)]c3, (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå), (c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  wlkv(c2, c0, c3)
  3simpc(c0 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  a1i(c0 ‚àà c1, ((c2 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß(c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), if((c3 ` s0)=(c3 `(s0[+]1)),(c4 `(c2 ` s0))= {(c3 ` s0)}, {(c3 ` s0),(c3 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c4 `(c2 ` s0)))))‚Üí(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå)))
  3adant3(c2 ‚àà Word(dom(c4)), (c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), if((c3 ` s0)=(c3 `(s0[+]1)),(c4 `(c2 ` s0))= {(c3 ` s0)}, {(c3 ` s0),(c3 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c4 `(c2 ` s0)))), (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  anim12i(c2 ‚àà Word(dom(c4)), (c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5), c2 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c2, Word(dom(c4)))
  elexd(c3, (c5[p‚Ü¶](0[...](# ` c2))), (c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5))
  fpm(c3, (0[...](# ` c2)), c5)
  ovex(nat0, cfz, (# ` c2))
  fvexi(c5, cvtx, c0)
  3expib(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå, (c2[(Walks ` c0)]c3 ‚Üî(c2 ‚àà Word(dom(c4))‚àß(c3 :(0[...](# ` c2))‚Üí c5)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c2)), if((c3 ` s0)=(c3 `(s0[+]1)),(c4 `(c2 ` s0))= {(c3 ` s0)}, {(c3 ` s0),(c3 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ(c4 `(c2 ` s0)))))))
  iswlk(s0, c0, c1, c2, universe, c3, universe, c4, c5)

blocks.name: wlkf
blocks.content: The mapping enumerating the (indices of the) edges of a walk is a word over the indices of the edges of the graph. (Contributed by AV, 5-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkcl
blocks.content: A walk has length ` # ( F ) ` , which is an integer. Formerly proven for an Eulerian path, see ~ eupthcl . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkp
blocks.content: The mapping enumerating the vertices of a walk is a function. (Contributed by AV, 5-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkpwrd
blocks.content: The sequence of vertices of a walk is a word over the set of vertices. (Contributed by AV, 27-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: wlklenvp1
blocks.content: The number of vertices of a walk (in an undirected graph) is the number of its edges plus 1. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 29-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-May-2021.)

blocks.name: wksv
blocks.content: The class of walks is a set. (Contributed by AV, 15-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm wksv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wcel(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1))), universe)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  ax-mp(wcel(copab(s0, s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1))), universe), wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), universe))
  fvex(cvtx, c0)
  opabex2(s0, s1, cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0))), universe, cword(cfv(cvtx, c0)), universe, wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), universe), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)))
  mp1i(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), universe), wcel(cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0))), universe), wcel(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), universe))
  dmex(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  fvex(ciedg, c0)
  wrdexg(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), universe)
  wrdexg(cfv(cvtx, c0), universe)
  adantl(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), universe), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))))
  wlkf(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1), cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  adantl(wcel(cfv(cvtx, c0), universe), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s1), cword(cfv(cvtx, c0))))
  wlkpwrd(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1), cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  diff.cword.s(s0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s0)
  diff.cword.s(s0, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  diff.cword.s(s1, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  diff.cdm.s(s1, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s1)
  diff.cword.s(s1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cfv(cvtx, c0), universe)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cvtx, c0)
  diff.cvtx.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cfv(cvtx, c0), universe)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cvtx, c0)
  diff.cvtx.s(s1)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm wksv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ { < s0, s1 > | s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 } ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  ax-mp({ < s0, s1 > | s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1 } ‚àà ùïå, (Vtx ` c0)‚àà ùïå)
  fvex(cvtx, c0)
  opabex2(s0, s1, Word(dom((iEdg ` c0))), universe, Word((Vtx ` c0)), universe, (Vtx ` c0)‚àà ùïå, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1)
  mp1i((Vtx ` c0)‚àà ùïå, Word(dom((iEdg ` c0)))‚àà ùïå, dom((iEdg ` c0))‚àà ùïå)
  dmex((iEdg ` c0))
  fvex(ciedg, c0)
  wrdexg(dom((iEdg ` c0)), universe)
  wrdexg((Vtx ` c0), universe)
  adantl((Vtx ` c0)‚àà ùïå, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1, s0 ‚àà Word(dom((iEdg ` c0))))
  wlkf(s0, c0, s1, (iEdg ` c0))
  eqid((iEdg ` c0))
  adantl((Vtx ` c0)‚àà ùïå, s0[(Walks ` c0)]s1, s1 ‚àà Word((Vtx ` c0)))
  wlkpwrd(s0, c0, s1, (Vtx ` c0))
  eqid((Vtx ` c0))
  diff.cword.s(s0, dom((iEdg ` c0)))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, (iEdg ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s0)
  diff.cword.s(s0, (Vtx ` c0))
  diff.cword.s(s1, dom((iEdg ` c0)))
  diff.cdm.s(s1, (iEdg ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s1)
  diff.cword.s(s1, (Vtx ` c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, (Vtx ` c0), universe)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cvtx, c0)
  diff.cvtx.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, (Vtx ` c0), universe)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cvtx, c0)
  diff.cvtx.s(s1)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: wlkn0
blocks.content: The sequence of vertices of a walk cannot be empty, i.e. a walk always consists of at least one vertex. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 2-Jan-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm wlkn0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wne(c2, emptycls))
} = {
  mpbird(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wne(c2, emptycls), wne(cdm(c2), emptycls))
  eqnetrrd(cdm(c2), emptycls, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wceq(co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c2)), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)))
  eqcomd(co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cdm(c2), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)))
  fdm(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wne(co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), emptycls), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0))
  wlkcl(c0, c1, c2)
  sylbb2(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wne(co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), emptycls), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(cuz, nat0)))
  elnn0uz(cfv(chash, c0))
  fzn0(nat0, cfv(chash, c0))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wb(wne(c2, emptycls), wne(cdm(c2), emptycls)), wrel(c2))
  syl(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wrel(c2), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)))
  wlkp(c0, c1, c2, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  frel(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1))
  necon3bid(c2, emptycls, cdm(c2), emptycls, wrel(c2))
  reldm0(c2)
}

  ‚ä¢ (c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2 ‚Üí c2 ‚â† ‚àÖ)

  eqcomd((0[...](# ` c0)), dom(c2), (c2 :(0[...](# ` c0))‚Üí(Vtx ` c1)))
  fdm(c2, (0[...](# ` c0)), (Vtx ` c1))

  elnn0uz((# ` c0))

blocks.name: wlklenvm1
blocks.content: The number of edges of a walk is the number of its vertices minus 1. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 2-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: ifpsnprss
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ wlkvtxeledg : Two adjacent (not necessarily different) vertices ` A ` and ` B ` in a walk are incident with an edge ` E ` . (Contributed by AV, 4-Apr-2021.) (Revised by AV, 5-Nov-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkvtxeledg
blocks.content: Each pair of adjacent vertices in a walk is a subset of an edge. (Contributed by AV, 28-Jan-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 4-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c1))

} = {
  mpcom(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))), w3a(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))

  iswlk(s0, c1, universe, c0, universe, c2, universe, c3, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c1))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(cvtx, c1)), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))
  ralimi(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))

  syl(wa(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))), wcel(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), crn(c3)), wne(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), emptycls))
  adantl(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))), wne(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), emptycls))
  mpan2(wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))), wne(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), emptycls), wne(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), emptycls))

blocks.name: relwlk
blocks.content: The set ` ( Walks `` G ) ` of all walks on ` G ` is a set of pairs by our definition of a walk, and so is a relation. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 19-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkvv
blocks.content: If there is at least one walk in the graph, all walks are in the universal class of ordered pairs. (Contributed by AV, 2-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkop
blocks.content: A walk is an ordered pair. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: wlkcpr
blocks.content: A walk as class with two components. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 2-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: wlk2f
blocks.content: If there is a walk ` W ` there is a pair of functions representing this walk. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Jul-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm wlk2f(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1)), wex(s0, wex(s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c1), cv(s1)))))

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

  sylbi(wcel(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1)), wex(s0, wex(s1, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c1), cv(s1)))), wbr(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cwlks, c1), cfv(c2nd, c0)))

  fvex(c1st, c0)
  fvex(c2nd, c0)

  diff.wbr.s(s0, cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cwlks, c1), cfv(c2nd, c0))

thm wlk2f(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà(Walks ` c1)‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÉ(s1, s0[(Walks ` c1)]s1)))

blocks.name: wlkcomp
blocks.content: A walk expressed by properties of its components. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Jun-2018.) (Revised by AV, 1-Jan-2021.)

thm wlkcomp(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8) {

blocks.name: wlk1walk
blocks.content: A walk is a 1-walk "on the edge level" according to Aksoy et al. (Contributed by AV, 30-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: upgrwlkedg
blocks.content: The edges of a walk in a pseudograph join exactly the two corresponding adjacent vertices in the walk. (Contributed by AV, 27-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm upgrwlkedg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2)), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))), w3a(wcel(c1, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c1)), cfv(cvtx, c0)), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))))
  upgriswlk(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  simp3(wcel(c1, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c1)), cfv(cvtx, c0)), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cvtx, c0)
  diff.cvtx.s(s0)
}

thm wlkvtxedg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wrex(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(s1)))))

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  sylib(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wrex(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(s1)))), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wrex(s1, crn(cfv(ciedg, c1)), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(s1)))))
  wlkvtxiedg(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c1))
  ralbii(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wrex(s1, crn(cfv(ciedg, c1)), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(s1))), wrex(s1, c3, wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(s1))))
  rexeqi(s1, crn(cfv(ciedg, c1)), c3, wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cv(s1)))

  diff.cfv.s(s1, ciedg, c1)

}

} = {
  sylib(c0[(Walks ` c1)]c2, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c0)), ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c3, {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ s1)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c0)), ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà ran((iEdg ` c1)), {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ s1)))

  eqid((iEdg ` c1))
  ralbii(s0, (0[..^](# ` c0)), ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà ran((iEdg ` c1)), {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ s1), ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c3, {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ s1))
  rexeqi(s1, ran((iEdg ` c1)), c3, {(c2 ` s0),(c2 `(s0[+]1))} ‚äÜ s1)

blocks.content: The pairs of connected vertices of a walk are edges in a pseudograph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 2-Jan-2021.)

  ralimdva(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wa(wcel(c1, cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))), wcel(c0, cupgr)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))), wcel(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), c3))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wa(wcel(c1, cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))), wcel(c0, cupgr)), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)))), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))), wcel(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), c3), wcel(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cfv(c1, cv(s0))), c3))

  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1))‚Üí((2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3)‚Üí c2 = c3))
} = {
  ex(((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1)), (2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3), c2 = c3)

  adantr(((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1)), (2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3), c1 =(# `(1st ` c3)))
  3ad2ant3((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0), (c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1), (c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1), c1 =(# `(1st ` c3)))
  eqcomd(c1, (# `(1st ` c3)), (c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1))
  simpr(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0), (# `(1st ` c3))= c1)
  ralrimivw(hs0, (0[...]c1), (((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1))‚àß(2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3)), ((2nd ` c2)` hs0)=((2nd ` c3)` hs0))
  adantl(((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1)), (2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3), ((2nd ` c2)` hs0)=((2nd ` c3)` hs0))
  fveq1((2nd ` c2), (2nd ` c3), hs0)
  syl3anc((((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1))‚àß(2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3)), (c2 = c3 ‚Üî(c1 =(# `(1st ` c3))‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(0[...]c1),((2nd ` c2)` hs0)=((2nd ` c3)` hs0)))), c0 ‚àà USPGraph, (c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)), c1 =(# `(1st ` c2)))
  simpl1l(c0 ‚àà USPGraph, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, (c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1), (c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1), (2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3))
  adantr(((c0 ‚àà USPGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚àß(c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c2))= c1)‚àß(c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß(# `(1st ` c3))= c1)), (2nd ` c2)=(2nd ` c3), (c2 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)‚àß c3 ‚àà(Walks ` c0)))

  wlkcpr(c1, c0)

  ralimdv(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cumgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2)), wcel(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(cedg, c0)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cumgr), wbr(c1, cfv(cwlks, c0), c2), wi(wcel(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(cedg, c0)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))

  diff.cumgr.s(s0)

  eqtri(cwlkson, cmpt(hs2, universe, cmpo(hs0, hs1, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), copab(s0, s1, wa(wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cv(hs1))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, cv(hs2)), cv(s1)))))), cmpt(hs2, universe, cmpo(hs0, hs1, cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), cfv(cvtx, cv(hs2)), copab(s0, s1, w3a(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, cv(hs2)), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), nat0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(chash, cv(s0))), cv(hs1)))))))

  eqeq2(hs0, c0, (s1 ` 0))

  biidd(hs2 = c3, ((s1 ` 0)= hs0 ‚àß(s1 `(# ` s0))= hs1))
  eqtri(cwlkson, (hs2 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(hs0 ‚àà(Vtx ` hs2), hs1 ‚àà(Vtx ` hs2)‚Ü¶ { < s0, s1 > |(((s1 ` 0)= hs0 ‚àß(s1 `(# ` s0))= hs1)‚àß s0[(Walks ` hs2)]s1)})), (hs2 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(hs0 ‚àà(Vtx ` hs2), hs1 ‚àà(Vtx ` hs2)‚Ü¶ { < s0, s1 > |(s0[(Walks ` hs2)]s1 ‚àß(s1 ` 0)= hs0 ‚àß(s1 `(# ` s0))= hs1)})))
  df-wlkson(hs2, hs0, hs1, s0, s1)

blocks.content: Properties of a pair of functions to be a walk between two given vertices (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 2-Nov-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Dec-2020.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2021.)

thm iswlkon(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c6))), wb(wbr(c3, co(c0, cfv(cwlkson, c7), c2), c5), w3a(wbr(c3, cfv(cwlks, c7), c5), wceq(cfv(c5, nat0), c0), wceq(cfv(c5, cfv(chash, c3)), c2))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c7))
} = {
  3expb(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c6), wb(wbr(c3, co(c0, cfv(cwlkson, c7), c2), c5), w3a(wbr(c3, cfv(cwlks, c7), c5), wceq(cfv(c5, nat0), c0), wceq(cfv(c5, cfv(chash, c3)), c2))))

  wlkson(hs1, hs0, c0, c1, c2, c7)
  eqeq1d(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), c0, cfv(c5, nat0), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c5)))
  adantl(wceq(cv(hs1), c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c5), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), nat0), cfv(c5, nat0)))
  fveq1(cv(hs0), c5, nat0)
  eqeq1d(cfv(cv(hs0), cfv(chash, cv(hs1))), c2, cfv(c5, cfv(chash, c3)), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c5)))

  3adant1(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c2), c4), wceq(cfv(c4, nat0), c1), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(chash, c0)), c3), wi(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wn(wne(c1, c3))))

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå)

blocks.name: wlkres
blocks.content: The restriction ` <. H , Q >. ` of a walk ` <. F , P >. ` to an initial segment of the walk (of length ` N ` ) forms a walk on the subgraph ` S ` consisting of the edges in the initial segment. Formerly proven directly for Eulerian paths, see ~ eupthres . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-May-2015.) (Revised by AV, 5-Mar-2021.) Hypothesis revised using the prefix operation. (Revised by AV, 30-Nov-2022.)

thm wlkreslemOLD(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtx, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ciedg, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c6))))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), cres(c5, cima(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cres(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8)))
  -| wceq(c2, cres(c7, co(nat0, cfz, c8)))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe))), wi(w0, wcel(c8, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c6)))))
  a1ii(wi(w0, w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe))), wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), cres(c5, cima(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8))))))
  3jca(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  pm2.61i(wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c0, universe))
  ax-1(wcel(c0, universe), w0)
  sylbir(wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wi(w0, wcel(c0, universe)), wnel(c0, universe))
  df-nel(c0, universe)
  com12(wnel(c0, universe), w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  mpcom(w0, wi(wnel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, universe)), wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7))
  sylbi(wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7), wi(w0, wi(wnel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, universe))), wcel(cop(c6, c7), cfv(cwlks, c4)))
  df-br(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7)
  syl(wcel(cop(c6, c7), cfv(cwlks, c4)), wi(w0, wi(wnel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, universe))), wne(cfv(cwlks, c4), emptycls))
  ne0i(cop(c6, c7), cfv(cwlks, c4))
  com13(wne(cfv(cwlks, c4), emptycls), w0, wnel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  expcom(wnel(c0, universe), w0, wi(wne(cfv(cwlks, c4), emptycls), wcel(c0, universe)))
  3syl(wa(w0, wnel(c0, universe)), wi(wne(cfv(cwlks, c4), emptycls), wcel(c0, universe)), wa(wnel(c0, universe), wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfv(cvtx, c4))), wceq(cfv(cwlks, c4), emptycls))
  ancomd(wa(w0, wnel(c0, universe)), wnel(c0, universe), wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfv(cvtx, c4)))
  anim1i(w0, wnel(c0, universe), wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfv(cvtx, c4)))
  syl6eq(cfv(cvtx, c0), cfv(cvtx, c4), c3, w0)
  wlk0prc(c0, c4)
  eqneqall(cfv(cwlks, c4), emptycls, wcel(c0, universe))
  syl5eqel(c1, universe, cres(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8)), w0)
  sylancl(w0, wcel(cres(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8)), universe), wfun(c6), wcel(co(nat0, cfzo, c8), universe))
  3syl(w0, wfun(c6), wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7), wcel(c6, cword(cdm(c5))))
  wlkf(c6, c4, c7, c5)
  ffund(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c6)), cdm(c5), wcel(c6, cword(cdm(c5))))
  wrdf(c6, cdm(c5))
  ovex(nat0, cfzo, c8)
  resfunexg(c6, co(nat0, cfzo, c8), universe)
  syl5eqel(c2, universe, cres(c7, co(nat0, cfz, c8)), w0)
  sylancl(w0, wcel(cres(c7, co(nat0, cfz, c8)), universe), wfun(c7), wcel(co(nat0, cfz, c8), universe))
  3syl(w0, wfun(c7), wbr(c6, cfv(cwlks, c4), c7), wf(c7, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c6)), c3))
  wlkp(c6, c4, c7, c3)
  ffun(c7, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c6)), c3)
  ovex(nat0, cfz, c8)
  resfunexg(c7, co(nat0, cfz, c8), universe)
}

thm wlkreslemOLD(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Vtx ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(iEdg ` c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c6[(Walks ` c4)]c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c8 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c6)))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(Vtx ` c0)= c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(iEdg ` c0)=(c5 |`(c6 "(0[..^]c8))))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(c6 |`(0[..^]c8))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(c7 |`(0[...]c8))
} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå)), (w0 ‚Üí c8 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` c6))))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß c2 ‚àà ùïå)), (w0 ‚Üí(iEdg ` c0)=(c5 |`(c6 "(0[..^]c8)))))
  3jca(w0, c0 ‚àà ùïå, c1 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  pm2.61i((w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå), c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  ax-1(c0 ‚àà ùïå, w0)
  sylbir(¬¨ c0 ‚àà ùïå, (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå), c0 ‚àâ ùïå)
  df-nel(c0, universe)
  com12(c0 ‚àâ ùïå, w0, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  mpcom(w0, (c0 ‚àâ ùïå ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå), c6[(Walks ` c4)]c7)
  sylbi(c6[(Walks ` c4)]c7, (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àâ ùïå ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå)), < c6, c7 > ‚àà(Walks ` c4))
  df-br(c6, (Walks ` c4), c7)
  syl(< c6, c7 > ‚àà(Walks ` c4), (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚àâ ùïå ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå)), (Walks ` c4)‚â† ‚àÖ)
  ne0i(< c6, c7 >, (Walks ` c4))
  com13((Walks ` c4)‚â† ‚àÖ, w0, c0 ‚àâ ùïå, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  expcom(c0 ‚àâ ùïå, w0, ((Walks ` c4)‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå))
  3syl((w0 ‚àß c0 ‚àâ ùïå), ((Walks ` c4)‚â† ‚àÖ ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå), (c0 ‚àâ ùïå ‚àß(Vtx ` c0)=(Vtx ` c4)), (Walks ` c4)= ‚àÖ)
  ancomd((w0 ‚àß c0 ‚àâ ùïå), c0 ‚àâ ùïå, (Vtx ` c0)=(Vtx ` c4))
  anim1i(w0, c0 ‚àâ ùïå, (Vtx ` c0)=(Vtx ` c4))
  syl6eq((Vtx ` c0), (Vtx ` c4), c3, w0)
  wlk0prc(c0, c4)
  eqneqall((Walks ` c4), emptycls, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  syl5eqel(c1, universe, (c6 |`(0[..^]c8)), w0)
  sylancl(w0, (c6 |`(0[..^]c8))‚àà ùïå, Fun(c6), (0[..^]c8)‚àà ùïå)
  3syl(w0, Fun(c6), c6[(Walks ` c4)]c7, c6 ‚àà Word(dom(c5)))
  wlkf(c6, c4, c7, c5)
  ffund(c6, (0[..^](# ` c6)), dom(c5), c6 ‚àà Word(dom(c5)))
  wrdf(c6, dom(c5))
  ovex(nat0, cfzo, c8)
  resfunexg(c6, (0[..^]c8), universe)
  syl5eqel(c2, universe, (c7 |`(0[...]c8)), w0)

blocks.name: wlkp1
blocks.content: Append one path segment (edge) ` E ` from vertex ` ( P `` N ) ` to a vertex ` C ` to a walk ` <. F , P >. ` to become a walk ` <. H , Q >. ` of the supergraph ` S ` obtained by adding the new edge to the graph ` G ` . Formerly proven directly for Eulerian paths (for pseudographs), see ~ eupthp1 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2015.) (Revised by AV, 6-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: wlkd
blocks.content: Two words representing a walk in a graph. (Contributed by AV, 7-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm wlkd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cword(universe)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cword(universe)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(chash, c2), co(cfv(chash, c0), caddc, nat1)))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))))))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wne(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cvtx, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), wcel(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), c5)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpbir3and(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))
  wlkdlem3(s0, c0, c3, c2, w0)
  wlkdlem1(s0, c2, c0, c5, w0)
  wlkdlem4(s0, c0, c2, c3, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cwlks, c1), c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cword(cdm(c3))), wf(c2, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)), wif(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), csn(cfv(c2, cv(s0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0)))))))), wcel(c1, c4), wcel(c0, cword(universe)), wcel(c2, cword(universe)))
  iswlk(s0, c1, c4, c0, cword(universe), c2, cword(universe), c3, c5)
}
